description: Dunckley sequence: number of bases in which composite n is Smith.
references: A. Vella and D. Vella, On Smith and Dunckley Numbers, Mathematics Today (Bull. Inst. Math. Appl), Vol. 37, no. 2 (2001), 54-56.
A. Vella and D. Vella, More Properties of Dunckley Numbers (in preparation)
example: 6, 8, 9 and 12 are not Smith in any base and so d(n) = 0 for these, 10 is Smith only in base 4 so d(10)=1
author: Alfred and Dominic Vella (dunckley(AT)thevellas.freeserve.co.uk), Mar 19 2001
